Cloud-based solutions for managing IoT networks vary in pricing depending on factors such as the number of devices, type of services required, and level of support needed. Here are some examples of pricing models for popular cloud-based IoT solutions:

1. Microsoft Azure IoT Suite: This solution offers a pay-as-you-go pricing model that allows you to pay for only the resources you use, with prices starting at $0.008 per message for device-to-cloud telemetry.

2. IBM Watson IoT: The pricing for this solution varies based on the number of devices and the type of services required. The standard plan starts at $0.50 per device per month, with additional charges for premium services such as real-time data analytics.

3. AWS IoT: AWS IoT offers a free tier for up to 250,000 messages per month and charges for additional usage based on the amount of data sent and received.

4. Google Cloud IoT: This solution offers a pricing model based on the number of devices and the amount of data transferred. Prices range from $0.0045 per device per month to $0.12 per GB.

It is important to note that these are just examples, and pricing may vary depending on the specific needs of your IoT network. When evaluating cloud-based solutions, it is important to consider not only the upfront costs but also any additional costs associated with support, maintenance, and usage. Additionally, it is important to consider the level of flexibility and scalability that each solution provides, as these factors will impact the long-term costs of the solution.
